intro: Batesia floribunda, commonly known as the white-flowered false hibiscus, is a striking tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Batesia floribunda is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
